title: 해리 포터: 세계적인 현상
description: 해리 포터 시리즈에 대한 글을 읽고 수동태와 관계대명사를 이해합니다.

passage.text:
Harry Potter, which was written by J.K. Rowling, is one of the most successful book series in history. The story, which follows a young wizard named Harry Potter, has been translated into over 80 languages and has sold more than 500 million copies worldwide.

The first book, "Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone," was published in 1997. It was initially rejected by twelve publishers before it was finally accepted by Bloomsbury. The book, which tells the story of Harry's first year at Hogwarts School, became an instant bestseller.

J.K. Rowling, whose life story is as inspiring as her books, was a single mother who wrote the first book in cafes while her baby daughter slept. She is now one of the wealthiest women in the world, whose success has been earned through hard work and perseverance.

The books were adapted into eight films that were produced by Warner Bros. The movies, which starred Daniel Radcliffe as Harry Potter, Emma Watson as Hermione Granger, and Rupert Grint as Ron Weasley, were hugely successful at the box office. The final film, which was released in 2011, grossed over $1.3 billion worldwide.

The Harry Potter theme park, which was opened in 2010 at Universal Studios in Florida, attracts millions of visitors each year. The park features rides and attractions that were designed to recreate the magical world that appears in the books and films.

The series has also inspired countless fan communities around the world. Fans, who are called "Potterheads," regularly attend conventions and events that are dedicated to celebrating the series. The books have been praised for encouraging young people to read, and many children who were introduced to reading through Harry Potter have become lifelong readers.

Harry Potter has received numerous awards and has been recognized as one of the most influential cultural phenomena of the 21st century. The themes that are explored in the books, such as friendship, courage, and the battle between good and evil, continue to resonate with readers of all ages.

The legacy of Harry Potter, which began with a simple story about a boy wizard, has grown into something far greater than anyone could have imagined. It is a testament to the power of storytelling and imagination.
